com.percussion.services.catalog
Interface IPSCatalogItem

All Superinterfaces:
IPSCatalogIdentifier, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSAssemblyTemplate, IPSContentList, IPSDeliveryType, IPSItemFilter, IPSNodeDefinition, IPSTemplateSlot
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSAgingTransition, PSAssignedRole, PSAutoTranslation, PSCommunity, PSKeyword, PSNotification, PSNotificationDef, PSState, PSTransition, PSTransitionBase, PSTransitionRole, PSWorkflow, PSWorkflowRole
public interface IPSCatalogItem
extends IPSCatalogIdentifier

A single item that can be stored into or retrieved from a service. An item is capable of serializing and restoring itself into an XML document. The type is responsible for storing enough information to restore itself, the actual information about the type of the serialized document must be stored by the requestor.

Example: If MSM wishes to store an assembler, it can request a list of assembler ids from the assembly system. It can then store a specific assembler, but it must store with it the appropriate type id. On restoration, the type id is used to determine what service will restore the data.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

toXML

String toXML()
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException
Serialize the information in the item into XML format. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Returns:
a string containing the XML that represents the item. This information must contain the items guid, but is not required to hold the type information.
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem serializing the object
SAXException - if there is an issue converting the object to XML

fromXML

void fromXML(String xmlsource)
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException,
                    com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException
Restore the given item from an XML description. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Parameters:
xmlsource - the string that represents this item, never null or empty
Throws:
SAXException - if there is a problem parsing the xml source
IOException - if there is a problem reading the xml source
com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException - if the name of the supplied element is incorrect or any of its attributes or children are required but missing or incorrect

setGUID

void setGUID(IPSGuid newguid)
             throws IllegalStateException
Set a global identifier. Useful for setting the initial identifier for objects being newly created.

Parameters:
newguid - the globally unique id, never null. See IPSGuid for more information.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the object already has an identifier assigned
